data.description:
For ages 13 and up.

Among Us VR is a party game of teamwork and betrayal. Grab your crew and headset and launch into the VR version of this hit multiplayer deduction game. Play with 4 - 10 players as you complete tasks to hold your ship together. But beware! One or more random players among the crew are Impostors bent on sabotaging and killing everyone.

Features
● Gameplay: Experience the core Among Us gameplay you know and love, such as tasks, sabotages, emergency meetings, and venting, but now in VR
● Chat: Communicate using in-game voice chat (featuring proximity chat) or quick text chat
● Minigames: Play old favorites and new-for-VR games
● Customization: Pick your character’s color and hat; the new Hat Pack: Crew Favorites is available for purchase now
● Comfort and Safety: Adjust your settings to have the best experience possible
● Cross-Platform in VR: Play with other VR users, even on other VR platforms and headsets
● Locomotion: Choose single or two-handed options
● Custom Lobby Settings: 18 settings to customize the game

Join our Discord!
data.developer: Schell Games, Innersloth LLC, and Robot Teddy

changelog.change_log:
LIMITED TIME EVENT — LIGHTS OUT UPDATE

NEW ROLE: ENGINEER
Crewmates have a new friend in the form of the Engineer! This new role gives the Crewmate-sided player the ability to vent!
- New Role added!
- New Custom Lobby Settings Tab added specifically for Roles and their unique settings

QUICK CHAT IMPROVEMENTS
Several quality of life improvements have been made for Quick Chat communication options
- Long-pressing the map button opens up the Quick Chat menu or toggles between the map and Quick Chat menu
- Improved hitboxes for Quick Chat options
- Updated Quick Chat text options to better reflect useful messages and information for players
- Improved button detection on player Quick Chat to allow for easier messaging
- Improved how Quick Chat is drawn to make readability of the Quick Chat interface easier
- Fixed an issue where Quick Chat options would occasionally not update when new players would enter or leave the lobby

**LIMITED TIME EVENT: LIGHTS OUT**
Our first-ever Limited Time Event goes live with a brand new gameplay mode: Lights Out
- All Crewmates become Engineers
- All vents are interconnected
- Fluctuating lighting, depending on the state of the game (Every time an Engineer is killed, the lights get dimmer. After Engineers complete a certain number of tasks, the lights get brighter)
- New Mode accessible from the regular Play Online menu or a new UI element on the Main Menu
- Mode availability between February 8, 2024 until March 12, 2024

**LIMITED TIME HAT: OVERSCOPED**
Commemorate our first-ever Limited Time Event with our first-ever fully-animated hat!
- Limited Time Hat: Overscoped
- DLC available between February 8, 2024 until March 12, 2024

**FIXES AND IMPROVEMENTS**
Various bugs and quick-fixes have been implemented to improve the general gameplay experience
- Updated nametags to now support longer usernames
- Tweaked filtered words to avoid hiding some usernames that were not offensive
- Improved how lobby counts players to avoid issues when starting a new game right when a player is joining
- Fixed an issue where player names might be occasionally mismatched across host and client players
- Fixed an issue where match settings would not properly update for non-host players in the lobby
- Fixed an issue where the game could get confused on the exact number of live players when transitioning between voting and task gameplay states
- Improved visual states for timer icons such as sabotage to better match their visual timing
- Fixed an issue where player shadows would not correctly display in some unique networking situations such like when entering/exiting a vent
- Fixed a small issue when players would not fully disengage from tasks when entering a vent
- Added in audio caption for venting
- Fixed a small issue where the vent icons would not correctly display on vents when rapidly switching back and forth
- Fixed an issue where retina scan timings were different from the first scan compared to others
- Fixed a small issue where the TV in Polus would not correctly turn off volume depending on the knob setting
- Minor improvements to various task placements and rotations in Skeld II
- Improved sizes of kill/vent buttons for better readability
- Fixed an issue where the UI panels would be improperly-sized with larger text chat window
- Fixed missing or improperly-sized localization strings in various languages for better readability
- New failsafes implemented to address an issue where the map would not correctly reload in some instances on host migrations
- Fixed a rare issue where players could still get stuck in a black void when initially loading a map during a host migration
- Fixed a rare issue during voting which could prematurely end the game for players
- Fixed an issue where the Meta Quest player list may display users not in your current game.

LIMITED TIME EVENT — LIGHTS OUT UPDATE

NEW ROLE: ENGINEER
Crewmates have a new friend in the form of the Engineer! This new role gives the Crewmate-sided player the ability to vent!
- New Role added!
- New Custom Lobby Settings Tab added specifically for Roles and their unique settings

QUICK CHAT IMPROVEMENTS
Several quality of life improvements have been made for Quick Chat communication options
- Long-pressing the map button opens up the Quick Chat menu or toggles between the map and Quick Chat menu
- Improved hitboxes for Quick Chat options
- Updated Quick Chat text options to better reflect useful messages and information for players
- Improved button detection on player Quick Chat to allow for easier messaging
- Improved how Quick Chat is drawn to make readability of the Quick Chat interface easier
- Fixed an issue where Quick Chat options would occasionally not update when new players would enter or leave the lobby

**LIMITED TIME EVENT: LIGHTS OUT**
Our first-ever Limited Time Event goes live with a brand new gameplay mode: Lights Out
- All Crewmates become Engineers
- All vents are interconnected
- Fluctuating lighting, depending on the state of the game (Every time an Engineer is killed, the lights get dimmer. After Engineers complete a certain number of tasks, the lights get brighter)
- New Mode accessible from the regular Play Online menu or a new UI element on the Main Menu
- Mode availability between February 8, 2024 until March 12, 2024

**LIMITED TIME HAT: OVERSCOPED**
Commemorate our first-ever Limited Time Event with our first-ever fully-animated hat!
- Limited Time Hat: Overscoped
- DLC available between February 8, 2024 until March 12, 2024

**FIXES AND IMPROVEMENTS**
Various bugs and quick-fixes have been implemented to improve the general gameplay experience
- Updated nametags to now support longer usernames
- Tweaked filtered words to avoid hiding some usernames that were not offensive
- Improved how lobby counts players to avoid issues when starting a new game right when a player is joining
- Fixed an issue where player names might be occasionally mismatched across host and client players
- Fixed an issue where match settings would not properly update for non-host players in the lobby
- Fixed an issue where the game could get confused on the exact number of live players when transitioning between voting and task gameplay states
- Improved visual states for timer icons such as sabotage to better match their visual timing
- Fixed an issue where player shadows would not correctly display in some unique networking situations such like when entering/exiting a vent
- Fixed a small issue when players would not fully disengage from tasks when entering a vent
- Added in audio caption for venting
- Fixed a small issue where the vent icons would not correctly display on vents when rapidly switching back and forth
- Fixed an issue where retina scan timings were different from the first scan compared to others
- Fixed a small issue where the TV in Polus would not correctly turn off volume depending on the knob setting
- Minor improvements to various task placements and rotations in Skeld II
- Improved sizes of kill/vent buttons for better readability
- Fixed an issue where the UI panels would be improperly-sized with larger text chat window
- Fixed missing or improperly-sized localization strings in various languages for better readability
- New failsafes implemented to address an issue where the map would not correctly reload in some instances on host migrations
- Fixed a rare issue where players could still get stuck in a black void when initially loading a map during a host migration
- Fixed a rare issue during voting which could prematurely end the game for players
* Made adjustments to voice detection to improve voice chat performance

PATCH 8.1 UPDATE — 
Improve Matchmaking Flow
- Can now join matches in progress
— Join as an invisible spectator to observe the match and determine if it’s right for you!
- New rematchmake button
— Allows users to switch between matches without needing to return to the home screen

Gameplay Tweaks
- Enabled Quick Chat globally

New Hats Added Into the Game
- Five Freebea(n) Fungle Hats have been added into the base game
— King of the Sandcastle
— Floatasaurus
— Just a Little Funguy
— Crab Grab
— Hooked
- Hat Pack: Fungle Fresh Picks (6 new hats) now available as DLC

Patch 1.7.2 - Fidget Features

GENERAL DEV PATCH UPDATE
This Patch 1.7.2 update adds ‘Fidget Features’ from the B.E.T.A. to LIVE Channel.
Fidget Features (yeah, we made the name up!) are fun interactable objects hidden in the environment that are not tied to gameplay or a player’s tasks. The objects are hidden in plain sight and players will be able to discover them on their own time with each new applicable map and/or update. 
Additionally, this is the first batch of new content from B.E.T.A. to make it into the LIVE version of the game! 

FIDGET FEATURE DETAILS
New Fidget Features are being added to the Polus Point map. Players will be able to:
Change the TV channel in the Office
Engage with buttons in the Med Lab, Specimen, and Landing Zone 
Interact with sinks in Med Lab and Bathroom

Patch 1.7.1 - Small Bug Fixes

GENERAL DEV PATCH UPDATE
- This patch number is changing from 1.0.7 to 1.7.1. We are establishing a new version number scheme moving from 1.0.{patch number} to 1.{patch number}.{bug fix number}.

SMALL BUG FIXES
- Upgraded Oculus SDK
- Implemented more security against compromised host & client name changes
- Visual improvements for some strings of text
- Minor fixes for task and blindbox placement & rotations
- Fixed an occasional issue in which certain hallways would display an incorrect location name on the minimap
- Fixed an issue that would cause the sliders on the Monitor Tree task to become inoperable 
- Fixed an issue that would cause the microphone display to behave erroneously for Ghost players 
- Fixed issue that would cause a door to become stuck open when a player enters a vent while standing in the proximity of said door
- Fixed holomap issue in which extra Crewmates would appear after a player was voted out 
- Fixed issue in which living players would see the ‘Crewmate Speaking’ caption when a dead player was speaking

A MORE STABLE EXPERIENCE
- Tweaked the matchmaking process to be more robust overall with automatic retries when attempting to join a game and a better load-in experience when first joining a map
- Numerous backend improvements were made to multiple game systems to improve the overall stability of the game, allow for a better game experience, increase performance, and reduce bugs and rare crashes!

FIXES AND IMPROVEMENTS
- Updated the outlines for characters and hats for a nicer and cleaner look!
- Removed numbers from the end of player names so you can see more of your beautiful username in-game!
- Reduced time on how long the Ghost “you are dead” message appears in-game
- Resolved an issue where on first installs players would see a one-time hitch when moving from room to room in Polus Point
- Fixed a visual issue with the skybox on Polus Point when in the lobby
- Improved blindbox placements in various areas on Polus Point
- Improved how hands are activated when snapping into an assigned task
- Fixed an issue where the Monitor Tree and Balance Pressure tasks were accidentally turned on during the first round of play
- Adjusted position for the crane arm location during the Crane tasks
- Improved how initial values are chosen for the Distribute Calibration task
- Fixed an issue with initial rotation on the Chart Course task
- Fixed minor sound FX issues with the Open Waterways tasks
- Fixed an issue where sabotage map icons would have selection issues in some instances when attempting to trigger them
- Fixed a minor issue where map icons would occasionally overlap incorrectly
- Fixed a missing knife texture during Polus Point kill cutscene
- Fixed an issue where offensive usernames would cause color changes to not correctly map during wardrobe changes
- Fixed an issue where hands would not correctly hide during the tutorial
- Fixed an issue where footstep sounds would play even if the player was not moving when having their position reset
- Improved padding for East Asian languages including better padding on Japanese and Korean fonts
- Added in missing localization strings for a few error messages
- Fixed an occasional issue where players would receive an error message when certain network conditions failed
- Improvements to overall handling of internal game systems to improve overall game stability to avoid crashes and exceptions
- Fixed an animation issue that would cause the hands to float in a static position to the side of the crewmate and move only when the crewmate walked
- Fixed issue where languages using East Asian characters would not correctly display announcements.

MODERATION
- Players can now report other players for bullying/harassment in game
- Players can be banned from joining online matches for toxic behavior in game
- Voice chat is now moderated via ToxMod — Players’ voice chat is analyzed for harassment and toxic behavior and can be banned for violations
- Players can now view the network connection status and stability for other players on the Players tab

NEW BOOTUP EXPERIENCE
- Starting up the game has been revamped to reflect changes to our legal agreements, player reporting and moderation, as well as the addition of Announcements!
- Terms of Use and Privacy Policy agreements have been updated and need to be re-agreed upon for all players
- New ToxMod agreement has been added for voice chat moderation
- The game will occasionally update with news about *Among Us VR* and related events and announcements will appear on the title screen

MOSTLY POLUS FAVORITES HAT PACK
11 new free hats have been added into the base game cosmetics wardrobe
- Clogged
- ColdBrim
- Drill
- Eruptive
- Miner Setback
- OHSACompliant
- PHat
- Safety Second
- Snowmate
- Unique Specimin
- HORSE HAT

BUG FIXES
- Fixed an issue where being killed by an Impostor while pulling a lever using remote interaction could cause a crash 
- Fixed a rare crash where the Repair Shields task would get stuck forever causing the game to shutdown 
- Fixed an issue where the Divert Power task would never find a second console to resolve 
- Fixed an issue where venting as an Impostor while the game is ending due to a Crewmate victory could cause players to be stuck in a black void
- Fixed ghost and death VFX overlapping with each other during a kill 
- Fixed Impostor count not correctly updating when a living Impostor would disconnect from the game
- Fixed a visual bug where a red line would appear on the bottom of some cutscenes
- Fixed an issue where ghosts using Quick Chat could speak globally with all other ghosts
- Fixed an issue where the Crewmate shadow would not appear correctly in a specific area of Storage
- Fixed an error with an incorrect results screen being displayed when an Impostor kills at the same time when all Crewmates are completing their tasks
- Fixed an issue where hands for Impostors would not be in the correct position when venting with the “All Hands” visibility setting 
- Fixed an issue where tasks were not being correctly assigned in rare edge cases
- Fixed an issue where tasks would be empty when a player joins causing the game to shutdown
- Fixed a visual error where the chat offset was not being set properly as the chat log grew longer 
- Fixed an issue where some analytics were not getting counted correctly
- Recategorized the way that analytics were being sent after a player had left a game
- Fixed visual bug on the lobby screen where menu buttons would overlap each other
- Fixed minor visual bug on the minimap where O2 Sabotage icon would not draw correctly on top of other icons 
- Fixed minor visual bug where the emergency timer countdown would not be correct lit when lights were off 
- Fixed minor visual bug where sliders would jitter when being adjusted 
- Fixed occasional errors were the name for players would not correctly update 
- Added a small adjustment to better try and match player colors when joining a new lobby after a host migration 
- Fixed an issue where the game start countdown could end up in a bad state 
- Fixed an issue where returning back to the main menu would sometimes force you to go through the initial startup sequence again 
- Checkboxes on the Play Online menu now fade correctly with the rest of the menu 
- Fixed a rare crash related to disconnecting from the game during the end of a voting session 
- Fixed a rare crash related to minigames when a game session is shutting down 
- Fixed a rare crash related to hard drive space not being available 
- Fixed minor issues with overlapping texts in various menus 
- Fixed minor typos
- Fixed various issues on game shutdown

CUSTOM LOBBY SETTINGS
- Added 18 different options for Custom Lobby Settings for Among Us VR
- Hosts can now customize Among Us VR game matches using a variety of different settings in the lobby
- Players can now select custom or default match settings as a saved toggle during online matchmaking or when hosting a lobby
- Implemented optimized, single-mesh UI for the match settings page
- Added a balance indicator to display to players how current match settings will skew gameplay in favor of Impostors or Crewmates
- Updated match settings logic to allow for more easily transferable information across the network

FIXES
- Fixed crash where holding a lever while the game ends would cause a crash
- Fixed issue where cooldown timer visuals did not match the time left
- Fixed an issue where occasionally trying to host a lobby would return an error
- Fixed UI issue were critical sabotages would appear outside the Task List while viewing the Player tab
- Fixed minor visual bug where algae in Oxygen room was incorrectly rendering
- Fixed Crewmate shadows occasionally flickering in the game during certain moments especially in the lobby
- Fixed multiple issues where some errors were happening on game shutdown
Free We’re No. WUN! Trophy Hat - GMA

Stability Refactor Overview
— Connection/Black Void issues 
— Players not being able to join lobbies 
— Players not being fully visible 
— General connection issues as it relates to network traffic
— Host migration to no longer cause broken states (Works for both Meta & Steam)

Display Name 
— New Users
— — Hide Username will be unchecked for 16+
— — Under 16 will not have the option and default to color 

Specific Bug Fixes
CONNECTION
— Updated networking logic to reduce data sent and improve performance and reliability in general
— Made major changes to handling player connecting and spawn in to reduce players getting stuck in a black void while attempting to join a game
— Adjusted connection logic to reduce the number of times player will experience timeout exceptions
— Improved host migration process so it's much less common for players to get stuck in a black void during the migration
— Fixed issue where player could join a lobby and be invisible to other players

AGE CHECK
— Fixed age check prompt to correctly validate dates based on MM/DD/YYYY regardless of location
— Fixed age check being repeated asked upon returning back to the menu rather than just once when starting up the game 

BLIND VOLUMES
— Adjusted blind volume positions on the Skeld to avoid accidental blindspots in various locations 
— Fixed an issue where dying inside of a blindbox would disable it

VISUALS
— Fixed anti-grief volumes would disable after a few seconds when clipping through a player during the pre-game lobby 
— Fixed shadows occasionally not appear on players when they first spawn into a lobby
— Fixed issue where hands would briefly flash in a different location when releasing a button after an interaction
— Fixed issue where all hands would appear briefly when reporting a body before returning to the lobby
— Fixed issue where corpses from previous rounds and games would continue to remain visible for players even when starting a new game
— Fixed issue where previous victim's name would be displayed when reporting a new body
— Fixed a minor blip where the Impostor would briefly reappear in front of a vent after exiting another vent 
— Tightened transitions between cutscenes 

MINIGAMES
— Fixed an issue where Impostors would have a yellow highlight around non-completed tasks from a previous game
— Fixed an issue where getting killed within a minigame would not restart the minigame unless you moved in and out manually 
— Fixed players would snap to tasks in the Cafeteria during emergency meetings
— Fixed Upload Data task in Admin never resetting if leaving the Admin room while task was still active 
— Fixed Calibrate Distributors not correctly resetting visuals when leaving before completing the task 
— Fixed Align Engines issue where stepping away from the task could change your progress
— Fixed Chart Course continuing to play a sound even when disengaged with the task 
— Ghosts are no longer able to interact with the O2 sabotage 
— Fixed light sabotages not always correctly turning off in the lobby if timed correctly with a transition 
— Fixed an issue with Reactor sabotage would not resolve if using the trigger/grip button as the host 
— Fixed a rare issue where successfully completing tasks would not win the game for the Crewmates 

TUTORIAL
— Fixed issue where Crewmate death notification would not appear in tutorial 
— Fixed issue where footsteps could continue to play as a ghost in the tutorial 
— Fixed rare cases where you could never fix the O2 sabotage 
— Fixed critical sabotage not appearing on the map while active 

UI
— Settings menu can no longer be toggled on during cutscenes 
— Fixed issue where player reticles would disable early when interacting with multiple overlapping interaction areas 
— Fixed player chat and other UI being visible over the blinders 
— Fixed issue where placeholder text could be seen on the age verification UI 
— Fixed disconnected players still remaining visible on meeting interfaces during an emergency meeting 
— Fixed vote button remaining highlighted after voting when using both hands at the same time 
— Fixed minimap occasionally flickering after stopping or moving into a new room 
— Fixed an issue where the wardrobe button would remain highlighted if clicked repeatedly before it opens 
— Fixed countdown timer not re-appearing if a player had left and rejoined a lobby during a previous countdown 
— Fixed an issue where the holomap would show a player in the Upper Engine position even when no one was there 
— Fixed an issue where the holomap in Admin would not update in real-time with players 
— Fixed an issue where the Crewmate’s body would not be in the correct location if getting killed never leaving the cafeteria 
— Fixed an issue where the buttons on the start screen would make incorrect SFX sounds when hovered 
— Fixed an issue were the countdown timer would be obscured while in the wardrobe 

VENTING
— Fixed vent bars not appearing at the correct position while looking out of the vent in Cafeteria
— Fixed an issue where player can end up in a black screen when venting when match ends
— Fixed an issue where you could get stuck in a vent when transitioning while an emergency was called
— Fixed a rare issue where the Imposter's collision box would stop working if the game ended while in a vent

MISC
— Fixed rare crash for the game if the HMD device was not found when starting the game 
— Fixed issue where footsteps could play a bit too often even when not moving 
— Fixed issue where player could walk through locked lobby doors if they moved quickly enough when returning back to the lobby 
— Fixed rare issue where leaving the invite player menu on Oculus Quest could cause the controller to rumble indefinitely 
— Fixed issue where no timeout error popup would appear when being disconnected by the host in some instances 
— Fixed host migrations not working on Steam with voice clients 
— Fixed being able to set your Snap Turn setting to 0 degrees 
— Added notification if the game is unable to save any data because the system is out of disk space 
— Added notification when a game window is not focused and is not accepting player input
— Added missing localization for internet not found message
